description: Amazon Machine Learning is a managed service for building ML models and generating predictions, enabling the development of robust, scalable smart applications.
steps: Log in or create new account
In the dropdown from your username, select 'My Security Credentials'
On the left side, select 'Groups' and create a new Group with the necessary polices
Create new user and assign to existing group
After creating user you will see credentials

blocks.name: addTags
blocks.description: Adds one or more tags to an object, up to a limit of 10. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value. If you add a tag using a key that is already associated with the ML object, AddTags updates the tag's value.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: resourceId
args.info: The ID of the ML object to tag. For example, exampleModelId.

args.name: resourceType
args.info: The type of the ML object to tag. Valid Values: BatchPrediction; DataSource; Evaluation; MLModel

args.name: tags
args.info: Array of objects. The key-value pairs to use to create tags. If you specify a key without specifying a value, Amazon ML creates a tag with the specified key and a value of null. See README for more details.

blocks.name: createBatchPrediction
blocks.description: Generates predictions for a group of observations.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: dataSourceId
args.info: The ID of the DataSource that points to the group of observations to predict.

args.name: predictionId
args.info: A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the BatchPrediction.

args.name: modelId
args.info: The ID of the MLModel that will generate predictions for the group of observations.

args.name: outputUri
args.info: The location of an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket or directory to store the batch prediction results.

args.name: predictionName
args.info: A user-supplied name or description of the BatchPrediction. BatchPredictionName can only use the UTF-8 character set.

blocks.name: createDataSourceFromRDS
blocks.description: (BETA) Creates a DataSource object from an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS).

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: dataSourceId
args.info: A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the DataSource. Typically, an Amazon Resource Number (ARN) becomes the ID for a DataSource.

args.name: computeStatistics
args.info: The compute statistics for a DataSource. The statistics are generated from the observation data referenced by a DataSource. Treu or false.

args.name: roleARN
args.info: The role that Amazon ML assumes on behalf of the user to create and activate a data pipeline in the user's account and copy data using the SelectSqlQuery query from Amazon RDS to Amazon S3.

args.name: passwordRDS
args.info: The password of RDS.

args.name: usernameRDS
args.info: The username of RDS.

args.name: dbName
args.info: The name of the Amazon RDS database.

args.name: instanceId
args.info: A unique identifier for the Amazon RDS database instance.

args.name: resourceRole
args.info: A role (DataPipelineDefaultResourceRole) assumed by an EC2 instance to carry out the copy task from Amazon RDS to Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3).

args.name: S3StagingLocation
args.info: The Amazon S3 location for staging Amazon RDS data. The data retrieved from Amazon RDS using SelectSqlQuery is stored in this location.

args.name: securityGroupIds
args.info: Array of strings.  The security information to use to access an RDS DB instance. You need to set up appropriate ingress rules for the security entity IDs provided to allow access to the Amazon RDS instance.

structure.name: id
structure.info: The security group IDs to be used to access a VPC-based RDS DB instance.

args.name: sqlQuery
args.info: A query that is used to retrieve the observation data for the Datasource.

args.name: serviceRole
args.info: A role (DataPipelineDefaultRole) assumed by the AWS Data Pipeline service to monitor the progress of the copy task from Amazon RDS to Amazon S3.

args.name: subnetId
args.info: The subnet ID to be used to access a VPC-based RDS DB instance. This attribute is used by Data Pipeline to carry out the copy task from Amazon RDS to Amazon S3.

args.name: dataSourceName
args.info: A user-supplied name or description of the DataSource.

args.name: dataRearrangement
args.info: A JSON string that represents the splitting and rearrangement requirements for the Datasource. Sample - "{"splitting":{"percentBegin":10,"percentEnd":60}}"

args.name: dataSchema
args.info: A JSON string representing the schema. This is not required if DataSchemaUri is specified.

args.name: dataSchemaUri
args.info: The Amazon S3 location of the DataSchema.

blocks.name: createDataSourceFromRedshift
blocks.description: (BETA) Creates a DataSource from a database hosted on an Amazon Redshift cluster.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: dataSourceId
args.info: A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the DataSource. Typically, an Amazon Resource Number (ARN) becomes the ID for a DataSource.

args.name: computeStatistics
args.info: The compute statistics for a DataSource. The statistics are generated from the observation data referenced by a DataSource. Treu or false.

args.name: roleARN
args.info: The role that Amazon ML assumes on behalf of the user to create and activate a data pipeline in the user's account and copy data using the SelectSqlQuery query from Amazon RDS to Amazon S3.

args.name: password
args.info: The password of Redshift cluster.

args.name: username
args.info: The username of Redshift cluster.

args.name: dbName
args.info: The name of the Amazon Redshift database.

args.name: clusterId
args.info: The unique ID for the Amazon Redshift cluster.

args.name: S3StagingLocation
args.info: The Amazon S3 location for staging Amazon RDS data. The data retrieved from Amazon RDS using SelectSqlQuery is stored in this location.

args.name: sqlQuery
args.info: A query that is used to retrieve the observation data for the Datasource.

args.name: dataSourceName
args.info: A user-supplied name or description of the DataSource.

args.name: dataRearrangement
args.info: A JSON string that represents the splitting and rearrangement requirements for the Datasource. Sample - "{"splitting":{"percentBegin":10,"percentEnd":60}}"

args.name: dataSchema
args.info: A JSON string representing the schema. This is not required if DataSchemaUri is specified.

args.name: dataSchemaUri
args.info: The Amazon S3 location of the DataSchema.

blocks.name: createDataSourceFromS3
blocks.description: Creates a DataSource from a database hosted on an Amazon Redshift cluster.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: dataSourceId
args.info: A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the DataSource. Typically, an Amazon Resource Number (ARN) becomes the ID for a DataSource.

args.name: dataLocation
args.info: The Amazon S3 location of the observation data.

args.name: computeStatistics
args.info: The compute statistics for a DataSource. The statistics are generated from the observation data referenced by a DataSource. Treu or false.

args.name: dataSourceName
args.info: A user-supplied name or description of the DataSource.

args.name: dataRearrangement
args.info: A JSON string that represents the splitting and rearrangement requirements for the Datasource. Sample - "{"splitting":{"percentBegin":10,"percentEnd":60}}"

args.name: dataSchema
args.info: A JSON string representing the schema. This is not required if DataSchemaUri is specified.

args.name: dataSchemaLocation
args.info: The Amazon S3 location of the DataSchema.

blocks.name: createEvaluation
blocks.description: Creates a new Evaluation of an MLModel. An MLModel is evaluated on a set of observations associated to a DataSource.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: dataSourceId
args.info: The ID of the DataSource for the evaluation. The schema of the DataSource must match the schema used to create the MLModel.

args.name: evaluationId
args.info: A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the Evaluation.

args.name: modelId
args.info: The ID of the MLModel to evaluate.

args.name: evaluationName
args.info: A user-supplied name or description of the Evaluation.

blocks.name: createMLModel
blocks.description: Creates a new Evaluation of an MLModel. An MLModel is evaluated on a set of observations associated to a DataSource.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: modelId
args.info: A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the MLModel.

args.name: modelType
args.info: The category of supervised learning that this MLModel will address. Choose from the following types: Choose REGRESSION if the MLModel will be used to predict a numeric value. Choose BINARY if the MLModel result has two possible values. Choose MULTICLASS if the MLModel result has a limited number of values.

args.name: trainingDataSourceId
args.info: The ID of DataSource that points to the training data.

args.name: modelName
args.info: A user-supplied name or description of the MLModel.

args.name: parameters
args.info: A list of the training parameters in the MLModel. The list is implemented as a map of key-value pairs. See README for more details.

args.name: recipe
args.info: The data recipe for creating the MLModel. You must specify either the recipe or its URI. If you don't specify a recipe or its URI, Amazon ML creates a default.

args.name: recipeUri
args.info: The Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) location and file name that contains the MLModel recipe. You must specify either the recipe or its URI. If you don't specify a recipe or its URI, Amazon ML creates a default.

blocks.name: createRealtimeEndpoint
blocks.description: Creates a real-time endpoint for the MLModel.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: modelId
args.info: The ID assigned to the MLModel during creation.

blocks.name: describePredictions
blocks.description: Returns a list of BatchPrediction operations that match the search criteria in the request.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: equal
args.info: The equal to operator.

args.name: filterVariable
args.info: Use one of the following variables to filter a list: CreatedAt - Sets the search criteria to the BatchPrediction creation date. Status - Sets the search criteria to the BatchPrediction status. Name - Sets the search criteria to the contents of the BatchPrediction Name. IAMUser - Sets the search criteria to the user account that invoked the BatchPrediction creation. MLModelId - Sets the search criteria to the MLModel used in the BatchPrediction. DataSourceId - Sets the search criteria to the DataSource used in the BatchPrediction. DataURI - Sets the search criteria to the data file(s) used in the BatchPrediction. The URL can identify either a file or an Amazon Simple Storage Solution (Amazon S3) bucket or directory.

args.name: greaterOrEqual
args.info: The greater than or equal to operator.

args.name: greaterThan
args.info: The greater than operator.

args.name: lessOrEqual
args.info: The less than or equal to operator.

args.name: limit
args.info: The number of pages of information to include in the result. The range of acceptable values is 1 through 100. The default value is 100.

args.name: lessThen
args.info: The less than operator.

args.name: notEqual
args.info: The not equal to operator.

args.name: nextToken
args.info: An ID of the page in the paginated results.

args.name: prefix
args.info: A string that is found at the beginning of a variable, such as Name or Id.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: A two-value parameter that determines the sequence of the resulting list of MLModels. Valid Values: asc; dsc

blocks.name: describeDataSources

args.name: equal

args.name: filterVariable

args.name: sortOrder

args.name: filterVariable

args.name: greaterOrEqual

args.name: filterVariable
args.info: Use one of the following variables to filter a list. Valid Values: CreatedAt; LastUpdatedAt; Status; Name; IAMUser; TrainingDataSourceId; RealtimeEndpointStatus; MLModelType; Algorithm; TrainingDataURI

args.name: greaterOrEqual

blocks.name: describeTags
blocks.description: Describes one or more of the tags for your Amazon ML object.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: resourceId
args.info: The ID of the ML object. For example, exampleModelId.

args.name: resourceType
args.info: The type of the ML object. Valid Values: BatchPrediction; DataSource; Evaluation; MLModel

blocks.name: getPrediction
blocks.description: Returns a BatchPrediction that includes detailed metadata, status, and data file information for a Batch Prediction request.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: predictionId
args.info: An ID assigned to the BatchPrediction at creation.

blocks.name: getDataSource
blocks.description: Returns a DataSource that includes metadata and data file information, as well as the current status of the DataSource.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: dataSourceId
args.info: The ID assigned to the DataSource at creation.

args.name: verbose
args.info: Specifies whether the GetDataSource operation should return DataSourceSchema. True or false.

blocks.name: getEvaluation
blocks.description: Returns an Evaluation that includes metadata as well as the current status of the Evaluation.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: evaluationId
args.info: The ID of the Evaluation to retrieve.

blocks.name: getModel
blocks.description: Returns an MLModel that includes detailed metadata, data source information, and the current status of the MLModel.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: modelId
args.info: The ID assigned to the MLModel at creation.

args.name: verbose
args.info: Specifies whether the GetMLModel operation should return Recipe. True or false.

blocks.name: predict
blocks.description: Generates a prediction for the observation using the specified ML Model.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: modelId
args.info: The ID assigned to the MLModel at creation.

args.name: endpoint
args.info: Endpoint for predict. Pattern: https://[a-zA-Z0-9-.]*\.amazon(aws)?\.com[/]?

args.name: record
args.info: A map of variable name-value pairs that represent an observation. See README for more details.

blocks.name: updatePrediction
blocks.description: Updates the BatchPredictionName of a BatchPrediction.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: predictionId
args.info: The ID assigned to the BatchPrediction during creation.

args.name: predictionName
args.info: A new user-supplied name or description of the BatchPrediction.

blocks.name: updateDataSource
blocks.description: Updates the DataSourceName of a DataSource.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: dataSourceId
args.info: The ID assigned to the DataSource during creation.

args.name: dataSourceName
args.info: A new user-supplied name or description of the DataSource that will replace the current description.

blocks.name: updateEvaluation
blocks.description: Updates the EvaluationName of an Evaluation.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: evaluationId
args.info: The ID assigned to the Evaluation during creation.

args.name: evaluationName
args.info: A new user-supplied name or description of the Evaluation that will replace the current content.

blocks.name: updateModel
blocks.description: Updates the MLModelName and the ScoreThreshold of an MLModel.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: modelId
args.info: The ID assigned to the MLModel during creation.

args.name: modelName
args.info: A user-supplied name or description of the MLModel.

args.name: scoreThreshold
args.info: The ScoreThreshold used in binary classification MLModel that marks the boundary between a positive prediction and a negative prediction.

blocks.name: deleteTags
blocks.description: Deletes the specified tags associated with an ML object. After this operation is complete, you can't recover deleted tags. If you specify a tag that doesn't exist, Amazon ML ignores it.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: resourceId
args.info: The ID of the tagged ML object. For example, exampleModelId.

args.name: resourceType
args.info: The type of the tagged ML object. Valid Values: BatchPrediction; DataSource; Evaluation; MLModel

args.name: tagKeys
args.info: Array of strings. One or more tags to delete. Example: ["tag1","tag2",...]

blocks.name: deleteRealtimeEndpoint
blocks.description: Deletes a real time endpoint of an MLModel.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: modelId
args.info: The ID assigned to the MLModel during creation.

blocks.name: deleteEvaluation
blocks.description: Assigns the DELETED status to an Evaluation, rendering it unusable.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: evaluationId
args.info: A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the Evaluation to delete.

blocks.name: deletePrediction
blocks.description: Assigns the DELETED status to a BatchPrediction, rendering it unusable.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: predictionId
args.info: A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the BatchPrediction.

blocks.name: deleteDataSource
blocks.description: Assigns the DELETED status to a DataSource, rendering it unusable.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: dataSourceId
args.info: A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the DataSource.

blocks.name: deleteModel
blocks.description: Assigns the DELETED status to an MLModel, rendering it unusable.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: modelId
args.info: A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the MLModel.
